title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.3 MIDCH: CHILD-CENTRED LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, the education system provides holistic and child-centred learning and development in primary schools., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, benefit from healthy, nurturing, protective environments and live free from violence.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the education system provides holistic and child-centred learning and development in primary schools.

description.narrative: Unabated school closures until October due to COVID-19 heightened the need forsupporting learning continuity efforts at national and provincial level. This included developing guidance for home-based learning approaches, with a focus on student assessments, teacher and parental skills development and learning materials to ensure that all children, particularly the most vulnerable, can continue their education while they remain at home. Building on key evidence generated with UNICEF’s support,UNICEF played a catalytic role in;linking;the;COVID-19;response;with;longer-term system;strengthening and building back better efforts, including;a;blended learning approach under the ongoing education reform;framework.; | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
